title: Single-page site with big headline and code entry box

requirements.text: Create a single-page frontend view that displays the exact text "Bytes console winning!" in very large, prominent letters at the top/center of the page.

quotes: make a website that  says Bytes console winning! In BIG letters.

acceptanceCriteria: On initial load, the page shows the exact headline text: "Bytes console winning!"
The headline is visually dominant (large font size and strong emphasis) and clearly readable on desktop and mobile

requirements.text: Add a code entry UI directly beneath the headline: a labeled input box where the user can enter a code.

quotes: Then put a box where you can enter a code.

acceptanceCriteria: A text input is visible beneath the headline
The input has an English label or placeholder indicating it is for entering a code (e.g., "Enter code")
Typing in the input updates the local UI state without errors

requirements.text: Apply a coherent visual theme across the page (colors, typography, spacing, and background) suitable for a minimal “console/bytes” style, and keep it consistent for the headline and code input.
acceptanceCriteria: The page uses a consistent, intentional theme (not default browser styling)
The theme avoids a blue/purple primary look unless explicitly requested later
Layout remains clean and centered with sensible spacing on common viewport sizes

constraints: Frontend must not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or anything in frontend/src/components/ui (compose these components instead if needed).
Backend changes are not required for this request; do not add unnecessary backend features.
nonGoals: No code submission, verification, or backend persistence for the entered code unless requested later
No additional pages, routing, or dashboards
